statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: SHAMROCK OFFICE SOLUTIONS CLASSIC AT MORAGA CA

article.headline: Belmont 87, Rice 85
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Justin Hare scored nine of his 22 points, including the game-winning basket with 1.1 seconds left as Belmont overcame a 10-point deficit to defeat Rice 87-85 in the first round of the Shamrock Classic at St. Mary's College on Thursday. Rice's Morris Almond led all scorers with 28, and Chris Hagan contributed 16 to the losing effort. Belmont (8-4) saw a five-point halftime lead evaporate, as Rice (5-5) turned up its defensive pressure midway through the second half. Hare scored a basket after Hagan's two free throws put Rice ahead 81-71. He then sank a 3-pointer -- one of 12 by the winning Bruins -- to cut the lead to five. Andrew Preston failed on a three-point play for Belmont after Almond's basket, but Andy Wicke hit a 3-pointer after Belmont got the rebound. After a Rice miss, Preston tied the game with 1:27 to play. Almond put Rice back on top with a 12-footer from the paint with 1:13 left before Hare tied the game with an eight-foot leaner with 36 seconds to play. Chris Hagan lost the ball on a drive and was called for a double dribble as Belmont got the last shot. Hare connected on a 12-footer, and Rice's long inbounds attempt was knocked loose. Boomer Herndon had 14 and Preston, who went 6-for-6 from the floor, had 13 for Belmont. Patrick Britton added 10 for Rice.
